channel.title: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD)
channel.description: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD) generated by script

item.title: The Politics of Hurricane Melissa
item.description: The storm hit three island nations with vastly different approaches to climate adaptation.

item.title: How many people are already being killed by climate change?
item.description: New research shows which countries are most affected by heat, wildfires and disease

item.title: Trump and Xi Reach a Trade Truce
item.description: Beijing appears to be the bigger winner, leveraging Washington’s reliance on China to lower steep U.S. duties.

item.title: The Defense Implications of Trump’s Asia Trip
item.description: Featuring planes, ships, rockets, and nukes.

item.title: What Israel Means by a Two-State Solution
item.description: A closer look at the reforms that may be a prerequisite for Palestinian statehood.

item.title: Why Are China’s Generals So Quiet as Xi Purges Them?
item.description: The PLA is a politically neutered army.

item.title: A Ukraine-Baltics Security Pact
item.description: To deter Russia, Europe needs to bring Ukraine into its security architecture.

item.title: What Trump and Xi Did—and Didn’t—Agree To
item.description: From soybeans to semiconductors, here’s everything you need to know about what came out of the meeting.

item.title: China’s Global Initiatives Are Worth Taking Seriously
item.description: Beijing’s latest policy is vague but still important.

item.title: Trump’s Supporters Should Be Careful What They Wish For
item.description: If the US Supreme Court upholds President Donald Trump's use of the International Emergency Economic Powers Act to impose tariffs on US allies and adversaries alike, it will hand a loaded gun to future presidents. Why couldn't an administration use IEEPA tools to enforce a global minimum corporate tax or effectively ban crypto trading?

item.title: Trump’s Vagueness Over Nuclear Testing Could Fuel an Arms Race
item.description: It’s unclear whether his statement refers to warhead detonations.

item.title: The Trouble with Abundance
item.description: In a book released earlier this year, Ezra Klein and Derek Thompson argue essentially for “competent capacity”: a US that can effectively plan, approve, and execute projects. That is a worthy goal, but “abundance” is probably not the clearest way to convey it, let alone the most effective means of achieving it.

item.title: Trump and Xi Step Back From the Brink—for Now
item.description: The United States and China have struck a vague and reversible deal.

item.title: How Social Protection Can Accelerate Climate Action
item.description: A new report shows that the integration of climate objectives and social-protection systems can go a long way toward delivering finance where it is needed most. But making the most of these findings will require a new approach to designing, financing, and implementing social-protection programs.

item.title: Taiwan’s T-Dome Missile Defense: Balancing Deterrence, Risk, and Regional Stability
item.description: Taiwan’s T-Dome is designed to protect the island from missile strikes, aerial incursions, and potential amphibious operations.

item.title: India’s Massive Mining Push in the Fragile Northeast Causes Concern
item.description: It has identified over 36,000 sq km of mineral-rich land with a potential for 3,000 mines in the region. These could trigger conflict.

item.title: New Zealand’s Recalibrated Foreign Policy at Play in Southeast Asia
item.description: Part of Wellington’s foreign policy reset seeks to reinforce ASEAN’s role in anchoring the wider region.

item.title: Fractures and Realignments Among Pakistan’s Jihadist Groups
item.description: There are signs of a growing rift between the JuA and the TTP.

item.title: Can China Meet Its Massive Climate-Finance Needs?
item.description: The costs of decarbonizing the four highest-emitting sectors in China dwarf those in other major emerging economies, with India coming in a distant second. But while the figures might seem daunting, they are well within reach for China, which should be able to meet its own climate-finance needs relatively easily.

item.title: APEC Is More Than the Trump-Xi Summit
item.description: APEC has a lot to offer to the free and liberal international trade architecture.

item.title: A Perfect Match: Taliban Control Meets Global Apathy
item.description: When authoritarian regimes sever digital ties, silence becomes their most powerful weapon, and global apathy their most reliable ally.

item.description: America First need not put Africans last

item.description: K-pop and anime are the sound and symbols of the resistance

item.title: The Makings of Peace
item.description: While peace is often viewed merely as the absence of war, it has its own content and mechanics, which are perpetuated by ordinary people. A 14th-century fresco by the Italian painter Ambrogio Lorenzetti offers a glimpse into the beliefs, practices, and values that underpin a truly peaceful society.

item.description: The complicated life of women struggling with climate change—and cultural change—in Kashmir’s mountains.

item.description: Disarming the group will require Arab and Muslim forces—and strong American leadership.
